titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William E. Guckert Papers 1930-1977 AIS.1995.05
titlestmt.author: Dominic LaCava. The collection was processed by Andy Newman in November, 2003.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:23:17 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: This collection contains the papers of William E. Guckert for the years 1930-1977. William E. Guckert was a leader in the environmental conservation movement in Pennsylvania. He began his career as secretary of the Allegheny County Sportsmen's League, then became a lobbyist with the State Land Reclamation Board, and ended as Director of the State Board of Surface Mine Reclamation. Most of the records in this collection deal with Guckert's conservation efforts on strip-mines and mine reclamation during his career.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: William E. Guckert, 1908-1986, an early environmental conservationist, established laws pertaining to strip mines and mine drainage in Pennsylvania. Guckert began his conservationist career as secretary of the Allegheny County Sportsmen's League(ACSL). The ACSL was active in protecting, preserving, and conserving the natural resources of Pennsylvania and the nation. As secretary, Guckert helped lead the organization by calling attention to pollution, notably strip mines. In 1963, Guckert was selected to serve on the State Land Reclamation Board(SLRB), which advocated action against areas affected by strip-mining. Guckert acted as a lobbyist for the SLRB until 1967 when he was appointed Director of the State Bureau of Surface Mine Reclamation(SBSMR) by Governor Raymond Shafer. As director, Guckert established many of Pennsylvania's current conservation laws and awareness programs. He served as director of the SBSMR for ten years until retirement in 1977. William E. Guckert died on October 15, 1986, in Grove City, Mercer County, Pa.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the papers of William E. Guckert for the years 1930-1977. The concentration of papers from 1930-1950 deal with Guckert as secretary of the Allegheny County Sportsmen's League(ACSL). These records consist of meeting minutes, financial reports, constitution by-laws, membership, and correspondence. Most of the records are in the form of correspondence since Guckert was secretary of the ACSL. Guckert's Papers cover the State Land Reclamation Board period of 1963-1967. These records document how the ACSL helped push conservation legislation through lobbyist groups such as; the Allegheny Solid Waste Advisory Committee, the PA Sanitary Water Board, and the State Land Reclamation Board. Most of the SLRB's efforts can be seen in the reports and subject files on conservation. Guckert was Director of the State Bureau of Surface Mine Reclamation(SBSMR) from 1967 to 1977. It is evident that Guckert transferred many of his SLRB files to the SBSMR when Director. These records include legislation on land conservation, clean streams, strip-mines, and acid mine drainage. The last group of records consist of Guckert's research, news article clippings, and various large maps, that span 1967 to 1977. The files are ordered alphabetically by subject headings.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These papers were a gift of Dr. Kenneth D. Richert, 1995.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: William E. Guckert Papers, 1930-1977, AIS.1995.05, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: William E. Guckert Papers, 1930-1977, AIS.1995.05, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh
Guckert, William E., 1908-1986, Papers, ca. 1930-1970, ais 95:5

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was inventoried by Dominic LaCava in 1995 and then processed by Andy Newman in November, 2003.

Revision and rearrangement for the encoded version of the finding aid provided by Andy Newman in November, 2003. Information about the collection title and the controlled access terms was extracted from the MARC record in the University of Pittsburgh catalog Voyager ID number: 1579254

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Permission for publication is given on behalf of the University of Pittsburgh as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission of the copyright holder, which must also be obtained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series I reflects Guckert's time as secretary of the Allegheny County Sportsmen's League(ACSL)from 1932-1950. The papers consist of meeting minutes, financial reports, constitution by-laws, membership, and correspondence.

did.unittitle: The Federation News bulletins with resolutions
ACSL Pins (1943), Metal Car Emblem (1939-1940), Field Day Poster
Map of State Game Land, Allegheny Co.
Fisherman's Guide Map, Emporium, PA; Copy of Pittsburgh Sunday Post, April 6, 1924, on the establishment of the Sportsman's League

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The records of the State Land Reclamation Board(SLRB) pertain to the actual meetings, actions, and reports of the board between 1963 and 1967. Most of the legislation and research was carried over to the State Bureau of Surface Mine Reclamation in 1967 when Guckert became Director.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: A portion of the records from the State Land Reclamation Board, mostly legislation and research, was transferred to the State Bureau of Surface Mine Reclamation in 1967 when Guckert became Director.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series of records consist of Guckert's research, news article clippings, and oversize maps of PA counties, from 1967 to 1977. The files are ordered alphabetically by subject headings.
